title: Frank Warren hits back at Eddie Hearn’s dinosaur jibe and wants Chisora-Price winner for Daniel Dubois
text:
Josh Warrington has made it clear I must deliver a unification fight for him and I intend to do just that in 2020.

We had a deal with Oscar Valdez almost done before he vacated his WBO featherweight title to move up in weight. Leo Santa Cruz didn’t want to know, so that left us slightly out in the cold.

To go back to Elland Road next year we have to have a second world title on the line. WBC champion Gary Russell Jr is a possible opponent, but the problem with him is he only fights once a year. There’s also the option to move Josh up in weight. The main thing is to beat Sofiane Takoucht this weekend and make sure we don’t get stuck with another mandatory.

The IBF can be a pain when it comes to their mandatories. One thing is for sure, I don’t want to inflict Kid Galahad on the fans again. It’s a total liberty to get a final eliminator on the back of a loss. Completely baffling.

Warrington is back in action this weekend (Picture: Getty)

Derek Chisora vs David Price is a fight we’ll be watching closely. Joe Joyce or Daniel Dubois could fight the winner. We already offered Price the chance to fight Dubois or Joyce and he turned it down. I offered David Haye a large sum of money for Joyce to step in for Joseph Parker and they picked Price.

Chisora-Price is a good fight because you have no idea which version of either man will turn up. I’d back both Dubois or Joyce to beat either of them.

Not sure Chisora-Price could possibly be billed as a pay-per-view, but the world’s gone mad these days. Case and point: KSI vs Logan Paul. I’ve got no problem with these two kids wanting to fight each other. They’ll make a load of money in the process and that’s fine. It’s white collar boxing really.

What I do have an issue with is Eddie Hearn and co selling it like it’s a world class boxing event on pay-per-view. Surely we’ve got to have some standards, no? Hearn himself slagged it off when they fought last year. Now I’m the dinosaur? Spare me the hypocrisy.

Hearn is promoting KSI and Logan Paul’s rematch (Picture: Reuters)

If KSI and Logan Paul want a real fight I’m sure I can convince Anthony Yarde to knock them both out on the same night. Maybe I’ll join the circus too and promote Piers Morgan vs Jeremy Clarkson. Give me a break!

One fight that will be worth watching is Oleksandr Usyk’s debut. I’m keen to see how he gets on because if he can make the jump to heavyweight then he’d be a great opponent for Tyson Fury. The problem is Usyk isn’t the biggest guy, although he won’t be troubled by Chazz Witherspoon. It’ll be another four fights until we see if he can mix it at heavyweight, but I’m looking forward to finding out.
